<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// These are flags that the value mapping APIs allow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da89b60f3b4ad8c1e0ddb9a31b57cb13f9"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da89b60f3b4ad8c1e0ddb9a31b57cb13f9">RF&#95;None</a> = 0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If this flag is set, the remapper knows that only local values within a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function (such as an instruction or argument) are mapped, not global</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values like functions and global metadata.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da9a24bd8dba1bef2753bc3f087435ae7f"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da9a24bd8dba1bef2753bc3f087435ae7f">RF&#95;NoModuleLevelChanges</a> = 1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If this flag is set, the remapper ignores missing function-local entries</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (Argument, Instruction, BasicBlock) that are not in the value map.  If it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is unset, it aborts if an operand is asked to be remapped which doesn&#39;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// exist in the mapping.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// There are no such assertions in MapValue(), whose results are almost</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// unchanged by this flag.  This flag mainly changes the assertion behaviour</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in RemapInstruction().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Since an Instruction&#39;s metadata operands (even that point to SSA values)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// aren&#39;t guaranteed to be dominated by their definitions, MapMetadata will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// return &quot;!&#123;&#125;&quot; instead of &quot;null&quot; for \\a LocalAsMetadata instances whose SSA</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values are unmapped when this flag is set.  Otherwise, \\a MapValue()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// completely ignores this flag.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\a MapMetadata() always ignores this flag.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da5633028bc27ffa8eab39cc5de65b3108"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da5633028bc27ffa8eab39cc5de65b3108">RF&#95;IgnoreMissingLocals</a> = 2,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instruct the remapper to reuse and mutate distinct metadata (remapping</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// them in place) instead of cloning remapped copies. This flag has no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// effect when RF&#95;NoModuleLevelChanges, since that implies an identity</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// mapping.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437daf12b9f177771079708cf153bd90ec72b"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437daf12b9f177771079708cf153bd90ec72b">RF&#95;ReuseAndMutateDistinctMDs</a> = 4,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Any global values not in value map are mapped to null instead of mapping</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to self.  Illegal if RF&#95;IgnoreMissingLocals is also set.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da82f0aad0e304dfba85312039324e05aa"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da82f0aad0e304dfba85312039324e05aa">RF&#95;NullMapMissingGlobalValues</a> = 8,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3707e7ab83b58ea841f7b5e0ac83ccc4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adfe873034e2457bc9c9b291744c72f26">operator|</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Context for (re-)mapping values (and metadata).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A shared context used for mapping and remapping of Value and Metadata</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instances using \\a ValueToValueMapTy, \\a RemapFlags, \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ValueMapTypeRemapper, \\a ValueMaterializer, and \\a IdentityMD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There are a number of top-level entry points:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a mapValue() (and \\a mapConstant());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a mapMetadata() (and \\a mapMDNode());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a remapInstruction();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a remapFunction(); and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a remapGlobalObjectMetadata().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The \\a ValueMaterializer can be used as a callback, but cannot invoke any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of these top-level functions recursively.  Instead, callbacks should use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">/// one of the following to schedule work lazily in the \\a ValueMapper</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instance:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a scheduleMapGlobalInitializer()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a scheduleMapAppendingVariable()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a scheduleMapGlobalAlias()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a scheduleMapGlobalIFunc()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - \\a scheduleRemapFunction()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Sometimes a callback needs a different mapping context.  Such a context can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">/// be registered using \\a registerAlternateMappingContext(), which takes an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">/// alternate \\a ValueToValueMapTy and \\a ValueMaterializer and returns a ID to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pass into the schedule&#42;() functions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If an \\a IdentityMD set is optionally provided, \\a Metadata inside this set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">/// will be mapped onto itself in \\a VM on first use.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: lib/Linker really doesn&#39;t need the \\a ValueHandle in the \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ValueToValueMapTy.  We should template \\a ValueMapper (and its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">/// implementation classes), and explicitly instantiate on two concrete</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instances of \\a ValueMap (one as \\a ValueToValueMap, and one with raw \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Value pointers).  It may be viable to do away with \\a TrackingMDRef in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\a Metadata side map for the lib/Linker case as well, in which case we&#39;ll</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">/// need a new template parameter on \\a ValueMap.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Update callers of \\a RemapInstruction() and \\a MapValue() (etc.) to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">/// use \\a ValueMapper directly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper/#ad0c8b397f8b38de86898f8ad1a2f7ca5">ValueMapper</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;pImpl;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Look up or compute a value in the value map.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return a mapped value for a function-local value (Argument, Instruction,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicBlock), or compute and memoize a value for a Constant.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">///  1 If \\c V is in VM, return the result.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">///  2 Else if \\c V can be materialized with \\c Materializer, do so, memoize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">///     it in \\c VM, and return it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">///  3 Else if \\c V is a function-local value, return nullptr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">///  4 Else if \\c V is a \\a GlobalValue, return \\c nullptr or \\c V depending</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">///     on \\a RF&#95;NullMapMissingGlobalValues.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">///  5 Else if \\c V is a \\a MetadataAsValue wrapping a LocalAsMetadata,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">///     recurse on the local SSA value, and return nullptr or &quot;metadata !&#123;&#125;&quot; on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">///     missing depending on RF&#95;IgnoreMissingValues.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">///  6 Else if \\c V is a \\a MetadataAsValue, rewrap the return of \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">///     MapMetadata().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">///  7 Else, compute the equivalent constant, and return it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7d7375d2149eafc730d09e8e48089021"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7d7375d2149eafc730d09e8e48089021">MapValue</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal">                       <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a> Flags = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437da89b60f3b4ad8c1e0ddb9a31b57cb13f9">RF&#95;None</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal">                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemaptyperemapper">ValueMapTypeRemapper</a> &#42;TypeMapper = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Lookup or compute a mapping for a piece of metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compute and memoize a mapping for \\c MD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">///  1 If \\c MD is mapped, return it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">///  2 Else if \\a RF&#95;NoModuleLevelChanges or \\c MD is an \\a MDString, return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">///     \\c MD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">///  3 Else if \\c MD is a \\a ConstantAsMetadata, call \\a MapValue() and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">///     re-wrap its return (returning nullptr on nullptr).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">///  4 Else if \\c MD is in \\c IdentityMD then add an identity mapping for it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">///     and return it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">///  5 Else, \\c MD is an \\a MDNode.  These are remapped, along with their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="comment">///     transitive operands.  Distinct nodes are duplicated or moved depending</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="comment">///     on \\a RF&#95;MoveDistinctNodes.  Uniqued nodes are remapped like constants.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\note \\a LocalAsMetadata is completely unsupported by \\a MapMetadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Instead, use \\a MapValue() with its wrapping \\a MetadataAsValue instance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2e1cbfa3b8663c65505fcd7e5119638f"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2e1cbfa3b8663c65505fcd7e5119638f">MapMetadata</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42;MD, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
